item.title: About
item.description: I studied computer science at ETH Zurich and specialised in information security during my master studies. Currently, I work as a Junior Security Engineer at Futurae, an ETH Spin-off where we build secure and usable two-factor authentication. At SIB I teach the IT-Security course for their Chief Digital Officer postgraduate studies. Before, I worked as a Web Engineer at UniversitätsSpital Zürich and ABZ, and was the webmaster for bauenschweiz. I love to play the clarinet, swim in the Zürichsee, read books or play Dungeons & Dragons with friends.

item.title: Projects
item.description: WunderHabit A simple web application to connect your To-Do list from Wunderlist with Habitica. Website: wunderhabit.passuf.ch Source: github.com/passuf/WunderHabit Browser Fingerprint Research project to demonstrate how much data a browser reveals by just visiting a website. Demo: passuf.github.io/browser-fingerprint Source: github.com/passuf/browser-fingerprint Black Hole Service to collect arbitrary HTTP requests to see what your HTTP client is sending, e.g. when debugging webhooks. Source: github.com/passuf/blackhole FlatDist Finding the optimal place for your new flat can be a pain, so I wrote a small website to calculate distances from any address (your potential new home?

item.title: Contact
item.description: The best way to reach me is to send an email to jonaspasserini@gmail.com, or you can also find me on Twitter, GitHub, GitLab or LinkedIn.
